specification.name: cohere.command
specification.summary: Conduit processor for Cohere's command model.
specification.description: Conduit processor for Cohere's command model.
specification.author: Meroxa, Inc.

apiKey.description: APIKey is the API key for Cohere api calls.

backoffRetry.count.description: Maximum number of retries for an individual record when backing off following an error.

backoffRetry.factor.description: The multiplying factor for each increment step.

backoffRetry.max.description: The maximum waiting time before retrying.

backoffRetry.min.description: The minimum waiting time before retrying.

model.description: Model is one of the name of a compatible command model version.

request.body.description: RequestBodyRef specifies the api request field.

response.body.description: ResponseBodyRef specifies in which field should the response body be saved.

sdk.schema.decode.key.enabled.description: Whether to decode the record key using its corresponding schema from the schema registry.

sdk.schema.decode.payload.enabled.description: Whether to decode the record payload using its corresponding schema from the schema registry.

sdk.schema.encode.key.enabled.description: Whether to encode the record key using its corresponding schema from the schema registry.

sdk.schema.encode.payload.enabled.description: Whether to encode the record payload using its corresponding schema from the schema registry.

examples.summary: Generate responses using Cohere's command model
examples.description:
This example demonstrates how to use the Cohere command processor to generate responses for a record's `.Payload.After` field.
The processor sends the input text to the Cohere API and replaces it with the model's response.
